Draft Rating:

C+

Kiki Vandeweghe ranks in the 54th percentile for drafting among executives in our database. Vandeweghe's draft picks average out to be worth the equivalent of 1 spot lower than they were picked due to their terrible drafting.
Some of their biggest wins:
  • Drafted Brook Lopez with 10th pick but was worth 4th pick.
  • Drafted Ryan Anderson with 21th pick but was worth 9th pick.
  • Drafted Vincent Yarbrough with 33th pick but was worth 16th pick.
Some of their biggest busts:
  • Drafted Terrence Williams with 11th pick but was worth 35th pick.
  • Drafted Nikoloz Tskitishvili with 5th pick but was worth 34th pick.
  • Drafted Carmelo Anthony with 3th pick but was worth 4th pick.

Trade Rating:

F-

Kiki Vandeweghe ranks in the 2th percentile for trading among executives in our database.
Their biggest win:
  • Added Marcus Camby, Nenê, Mark Jackson to DEN.
  • Lost Antonio McDyess, Frank Williams, Maciej Lampe to NYK.
Their biggest L:
  • Added Rafer Alston, Tony Battie, Courtney Lee to BRK.
  • Lost Ryan Anderson, Vince Carter to ORL.

Signing Rating:

C+

Kiki Vandeweghe ranks in the 54th percentile for free agency signings among executives in our database.
Their best signings:
  • Signed Andre Miller in 2003.
  • Signed Chris Andersen in 2001.
  • Signed Earl Boykins in 2003.
Their worst signings:
